item.title: 玻利维亚为未来黄金交付筹集 5.89 亿美元资金
item.description: 美元匮乏的玻利维亚正依靠日益复杂的操作来筹集硬通货，用于偿还外债。【原文：Dollar-strapped Bolivia is relying on increasingly sophisticated operations to raise hard currency that it can use to pay its foreign debt.】

item.title: Blackstone 将从网上银行购买约 8.7 亿美元贷款
item.description: Blackstone Inc. 同意从 First Internet Bancorp 的一个部门购买多达 8.69 亿美元的商业房地产贷款，称为单一租户租赁融资。【原文：Blackstone Inc. agreed to buy as much as $869 million of commercial real estate loans known as single-tenant lease financing from a unit of First Internet Bancorp.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚筹集 90 亿美元抵押品以确保互换交易安全
item.description: 据一位熟悉内情的人士透露，哥伦比亚完成了约 93 亿美元资产的购买，作为一系列复杂掉期交易的抵押品。【原文：Colombia concluded the purchase of some $9.3 billion in assets to serve as collateral for a series of complex swap transactions, according to a person familiar with the matter.】

item.title: CVS 旗下 Omnicare 向 Alvarez & Marsal 寻求运营帮助
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，Omnicare 公司正在与 Alvarez & Marsal 公司合作，以帮助其解决现金流和运营问题，此前这家药房服务提供商及其母公司 CVS Health 因一起药物欺诈诉讼案被勒令支付 9.49 亿美元。【原文：Omnicare Inc. is working with Alvarez & Marsal Inc. for help with its cash flow and operations after the pharmacy-services provider and its parent CVS Health were ordered to pay $949 million related to a drug-fraud suit, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 大银行几乎被国债 10 年期拍卖拒之门外
item.description: 华尔街债券交易商周三比以往任何时候都更接近于错过财政部每月一次的 10 年期债券拍卖，这标志着这一新兴市场的参与率正在稳步下降。【原文：Wall Street bond dealers came closer than ever Wednesday to missing out on the Treasury Department’s monthly auction of 10-year notes, marking a steady decline in participation rates in the burgeoning market.】

item.title: 西班牙议会阻止缩短工作周，桑切斯受到打击
item.description: 西班牙议会投票否决了首相佩德罗-桑切斯（Pedro Sanchez）关于缩短每周工作时间的提议，这是他领导的苦苦挣扎的少数派政府遭遇的最新挫折。【原文：The Spanish Parliament voted down Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez’s proposal to reduce the working week in the latest setback to his struggling minority government.】

item.title: 康涅狄格州的 "债务节食 "取得成效，两次提升债券评级
item.description: 康涅狄格州本周在财政方面取得了胜利。【原文：Connecticut is collecting fiscal wins this week.】

item.title: 布宜诺斯艾利斯投票前阿根廷通胀低于预期
item.description: 由于布宜诺斯艾利斯省的一次关键投票引发了货币波动，阿根廷的月度通货膨胀率攀升幅度低于预期。【原文：Argentina’s monthly inflation climbed less than expected as a crucial vote in Buenos Aires province had stirred up currency volatility.】

item.title: 调查显示，股市将战胜风险，在年底实现上涨
item.description: 根据最新的《市场脉搏》（Markets Pulse）调查显示，股市将摆脱通胀风险和就业前景疲软的影响，在今年年底高歌猛进。【原文：Stocks will brush off inflation risks and a weaker jobs outlook to end the year on a high note, according to the latest Markets Pulse survey.】

item.title: 看涨甲骨文期权持有者有望获得 15 亿美元意外之财
item.description: 在甲骨文公司因云计算业务需求强劲而股价飙升之后，持有押注甲骨文公司反弹期权的投资者的持股价值跃升了约 15 亿美元。【原文：Investors who owned options betting on a rally in Oracle Corp. saw the value of their holdings jump by around $1.5 billion after the software maker’s stock soared on strong demand for its cloud computing business.】

item.title: 德州仪器首席执行官认为数据中心市场 "增长强劲
item.description: 德州仪器公司（Texas Instruments Inc.首席执行官哈维夫-伊兰（Haviv Ilan）表示，公司的数据中心业务正在帮助推动需求复苏，该领域的收入增长速度超过了 50%。【原文：Texas Instruments Inc. Chief Executive Officer Haviv Ilan said the company’s data center business is helping fuel a recovery in demand, with revenue in that area growing at a pace above 50%.】

item.title: 蓝猫鸮即将完成 27 亿美元的二次股权出售
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，Blue Owl Capital Inc. 即将完成对之前旗舰基金的二次交易，收集 27 亿美元的债务和股权。【原文：Blue Owl Capital Inc. is approaching the close of a secondary transaction for a prior flagship fund, collecting $2.7 billion in debt and equity, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 霍楚尔力促特朗普快速推进纽约核项目
item.description: 纽约州州长凯西-霍楚尔（Kathy Hochul）呼吁白宫帮助快速推进在该州建造核反应堆的计划。【原文：New York Governor Kathy Hochul is appealing to the White House for help fast-tracking a plan to build a nuclear reactor in the state.】

item.title: 纽约轮渡乘客人数创历史新高，该系统计划开辟新航线
item.description: 纽约市轮渡系统上个月的乘客量创下历史新高，该系统希望加强美国最大的乘客专用轮渡网络的航线。【原文：New York City’s ferry system saw record ridership last month as it looks to bolster routes on the largest passenger-only ferry network in the US.】

item.title: 政策猜测引发需求担忧，美国生物燃料股受冲击
item.description: 由于担心特朗普政府的政策可能无法完全抵消要求炼油厂在汽油和柴油中掺入可再生燃料的豁免规定，美国生物燃料公司股价下滑。【原文：Shares of US biofuel companies slumped on fears that Trump administration policies may fall short of fully offsetting exemptions from mandates requiring refineries to blend renewable fuels into gasoline and diesel.】

item.title: 墨西哥寻求将亚洲制造汽车的关税提高至最高 50
item.description: 墨西哥经济部长马塞洛-埃布拉德（Marcelo Ebrard）表示，墨西哥正寻求将亚洲制造的汽车关税提高至 50%。【原文：Mexico is looking to raise tariffs on cars made in Asia to as much as 50%, according to Economy Minister Marcelo Ebrard.】

item.title: 五角大楼稀土交易的对与错
item.description: 大家好，欢迎收看《奇货可居》时事通讯，这里每天都有来自《奇货可居》的精彩内容。有时是我们乔-韦森塔尔（Joe Weisenthal）和特蕾西-阿洛维（Tracy Alloway）为您带来我们对市场、金融和经济最新发展的看法。有时是我们的专家嘉宾和消息来源网络提供的内容。不管是什么，我们保证永远有趣。【原文：Hello and welcome to the newsletter, a grab bag of daily content from the Odd Lots universe. Sometimes it's us, Joe Weisenthal and Tracy Alloway, bringing you our thoughts on the most recent developments in markets, finance and the economy. And sometimes it's contributions from our network of expert guests and sources. Whatever it is, we promise it will always be interesting.】

item.title: 当经济坏消息变成股票坏消息时
item.description: 看看这张图表。【原文：Take a look at this chart.】

item.title: 霍楚尔表示，低税收和移民将使纽约在人工智能领域更具优势
item.description: 纽约州州长凯西-霍楚尔（Kathy Hochul）将纽约定位为人工智能公司的中心，认为对高收入者和移民人才实行有竞争力的税率，有助于纽约州在人工智能技术的竞争中胜出。【原文：Governor Kathy Hochul is positioning New York as a hub for artificial intelligence companies, arguing that competitive tax rates for high earners and immigrant talent can help the state win the race to lead in the technology.】

item.title: Blackstone 和 Ares 提供 36 亿美元用于收购 Park Place
item.description: 据知情人士透露，包括 Blackstone Inc. 和 Ares Management Corp. 在内的贷款方将提供约 36 亿美元的私人债务，为华平投资收购 Park Place Technologies 提供资金。【原文：Lenders including Blackstone Inc. and Ares Management Corp. are providing roughly $3.6 billion of private debt to help finance Warburg Pincus’ acquisition of Park Place Technologies, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 美国共和党重要参议员在人工智能监管辩论中呼吁 "轻触 "人工智能
item.description: 共和党参议员特德-克鲁兹（Ted Cruz）提出立法，以 "轻触式 "方法监管人工智能这一新兴技术，从而拉开了人工智能政策辩论的序幕。【原文：Republican Senator Ted Cruz kicked off a debate over artificial intelligence policy by proposing legislation to enshrine a “light-touch” approach to regulating the emerging technology.】

item.title: 达美航空公司称消费者信心在关税打击后反弹
item.description: 达美航空公司（Delta Air Lines Inc.首席执行官埃德-巴斯蒂安（Ed Bastian）表示，在今年早些时候关税和经济动荡造成 "巨大冲击 "之后，消费者信心已经反弹。【原文：Delta Air Lines Inc. Chief Executive Officer Ed Bastian said that consumer confidence has rebounded following a “big impact” from tariffs and the economic upheaval earlier this year.】

item.title: 从四张图表看甲骨文人工智能推动股市飞跃的意义
item.description: 甲骨文公司（Oracle Corp. ）今天在股市上创下了历史新高，因为该公司发布了让华尔街热议人工智能机遇的重大指导意见。【原文：Oracle Corp. is having a record-breaking day in the stock market after delivering blockbuster guidance that has Wall Street buzzing about the opportunities in artificial intelligence.】

item.title: 古驰所有者开云集团获得更多时间收购华伦天奴剩余股份
item.description: 随着法国开云集团（Kering SA）集中精力降低债务水平，该集团将有更多的时间来行使收购华伦天奴（Valentino）剩余股份的选择权。【原文：Kering SA is getting more time to exercise an option to buy the rest of fashion house Valentino, as the French group focuses on reducing its debt levels.】

item.title: 德国默茨公司（Merz）考虑在新天然气投产前放慢退出煤炭行业的步伐
item.description: 德国总理弗里德里希-梅尔茨（Friedrich Merz）在一次行业会议上表示，德国应考虑暂停关闭剩余的煤电厂，直到新的燃气发电厂准备就绪，可以取代这些煤电厂。【原文：Germany should consider a pause on shutting down its remaining coal power plants until new gas-fired stations are ready to replace them, Chancellor Friedrich Merz said at an industry meet.】

item.title: 次级汽车贷款公司三色公司申请破产
item.description: Tricolor Holdings 是一家向美国西南部客户提供汽车贷款的公司，这些客户通常信用评分较差或没有信用评分，该公司已申请破产。【原文：Tricolor Holdings, a provider of auto loans to customers across the US Southwest who typically have poor or no credit scores, filed for bankruptcy.】

item.title: EchoStar Airwaves 的出售意味着四人移动市场的消亡
item.description: EchoStar 公司将数十亿美元的无线频谱出售给 AT&T 公司和 SpaceX 公司，这将使查理-厄根（Charlie Ergen）和相关公司受益，但可能会使消费者面临更高的价格和更少的移动电话服务选择。【原文：EchoStar Corp.’s sale of billions of dollars in wireless spectrum to AT&T Inc. and SpaceX will benefit Charlie Ergen and the companies involved, but may leave consumers facing higher prices and fewer choices for mobile phone service.】

item.title: 淡水河谷首席执行官认为铜矿增长的动力来自于并购项目管道
item.description: 淡水河谷公司（Vale SA）首席执行官古斯塔沃-皮门塔（Gustavo Pimenta）说，公司 "在铜矿竞争中落后了"，将通过加快开发自己的矿业资产，而不是寻求潜在的交易来重新赢得市场。【原文：Vale SA Chief Executive Officer Gustavo Pimenta said the company “fell behind in the copper race” and will seek to regain ground by accelerating the development of its own mining assets, rather than looking at potential deals.】

item.title: 阿根廷举行关键债券拍卖会，米莱（Milei）公司倒闭引发市场恐慌
item.description: 阿根廷正在寻求在周三展期偿还数万亿比索的地方债务，这是对其阻止资本外流和支撑受创货币的一个关键考验，此前的一次省级选举表明，对哈维尔-米莱伊总统的自由市场经济改革的支持正在减弱。【原文：Argentina is seeking to roll over trillions of pesos in local debt on Wednesday, a crucial test in its push to stem capital outflows and shore up its battered currency after a provincial election signaled support for President Javier Milei’s free-market overhaul of the economy is waning.】

item.title: OCC 的古尔德欢迎 "法律允许的 "加密银行关系
item.description: 货币监理署署长乔纳森-古尔德（Jonathan Gould）说，他希望根除他所谓的两级制度，这种制度鄙视一些银行和数字资产行业之间 "合法、允许的活动"。【原文：Jonathan Gould, the head of the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency, said he wants to eradicate what he calls a two-tiered system that stigmatizes “legally, permissible activities” between some banks and the digital asset industry.】
